articles.title: Tiny male marsupials sacrifice sleep for a chance at sex — then all die at once and get eaten - Livescience.com
articles.description: Male antechinuses lose three hours of sleep every night during their three-week breeding season to boost their chances of mating, then they die off in a single event.
